definition: to push up one's sleeves/to reject or resist/to seize/to perturb/to steal
to push up one's sleeves/to reject or resist/to seize/to perturb/to steal

sentences.english: Towns in the populous trees, with hanging gardens of verdure.
sentences.chinese: 熙熙攘攘的城鎮，懸吊着翠綠的園林。

sentences.english: I like to go to Battery Park and watch those liners booming in.
sentences.chinese: 我愛巴特里公園，喜歡看着熙熙攘攘的郵輪。

sentences.english: The streets were crowded with people.
sentences.chinese: 街道上熙熙攘攘全是人。

sentences.english: She's looking down on the continued bustling activity of the main terminal concourse .
sentences.chinese: 她俯視候機主樓大廳裏持續的熙熙攘攘的活動。

sentences.english: While you were asking the way to dream castle, I was hiding myself in a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 你詢問去夢之城的路，我藏在熙熙攘攘的人羣中。

sentences.english: We had to fight through the crowded streets.
sentences.chinese: 我們得從街道上熙熙攘攘的人羣中擠過去。

sentences.english: To-morrow he would go into the roaring down-town district and find work.
sentences.chinese: 明天他要到熙熙攘攘的商業區去找事做。

sentences.english: At sundown you will find streets busy and shops aglow.
sentences.chinese: 日落時分，你會看到街道熙熙攘攘，商店大放光明。

sentences.english: The Saigon Postoffice near the church is always full of tourists.
sentences.chinese: 教堂附近的西貢郵局裏面總是熙熙攘攘。

sentences.english: Crowds and crowds of people bustle among brightly-lit shops and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 商場酒店的燈光中是那熙熙攘攘喧囂的人們。

sentences.english: Imagine if you will, a library clean and crisp, bustling with activity.
sentences.chinese: 想象一個熙熙攘攘的圖書館。

sentences.english: The children rushed noisily downstairs. None of them behaved nicely.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們熙熙攘攘地衝下樓來，沒有哪個表現得好。

sentences.english: The attack took place as the market was thronged with morning shoppers.
sentences.chinese: 襲擊發生時，市場上早市購物者熙熙攘攘。

sentences.english: This artery of central Misurata was once a buzzing high street.
sentences.chinese: 米蘇拉塔的主幹道曾是一條熙熙攘攘的大街。

sentences.english: The department store is in a noisy street.
sentences.chinese: 我們在熙熙攘攘的街道上緩慢行走。

sentences.english: The road is alive with lookers on.
sentences.chinese: 路上看熱鬧的人熙熙攘攘。

definition: lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
the stream flows without stopping (idiom); unending flow
crowded to bursting point/filled to overflowing/jam-packed
